item.title: Photo highlights of the day
item.trailText: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world
item.standFirst: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world including an outdoor screening at the Cannes film festival and yoga trainers performing on rafts in a lake

displayImages.caption: Salem, USA Former Florida Governor and potential Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush out and about in New Hampshire. Photograph: Rick Friedman/Rick Friedman/Corbis

item.title: Photo highlights of the day
item.trailText: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world

item.title: Photo highlights of the day
item.trailText: The refugee crises in southeast Asia and Burndi, flowers in Holland and Chelsea, and a temporary duck lane

displayImages.caption: Bujumbura, Burundi Anti-government protesters demonstrate near a burning barricade. Burundi’s army chief says an attempted coup has failed and forces loyal to Pierre Nkurunziza are in control, a day after another general announced that he had sacked the president for seeking an unconstitutional third term in office Photograph: Goran Tomasevic/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Protesters, who are against President Pierre Nkurunziza’s decision to run for a third term, gesture in front of a burning barricade. The head of Burundi’s army said on Thursday that an attempted coup had failed and forces loyal to Nkurunziza were in control, a day after another general said he had sacked Nkurunziza for seeking an unconstitutional third term in office
displayImages.cleanCaption: Bujumbura, Burundi Anti-government protesters demonstrate near a burning barricade. Burundi’s army chief says an attempted coup has failed and forces loyal to Pierre Nkurunziza are in control, a day after another general announced that he had sacked the president for seeking an unconstitutional third term in office

displayImages.altText: Cape Town, South Africa An Egret searches for fish in Kommetjie. In the early quarter of the twentieth century some of the world’s Egret species were endangered due to plume hunting for hat makers in Europe and the United States who used large numbers of Egret plumes for their hats. Fortunately Egret hunting was eventually outlawed and today numbers of Egrets are on the rise
